articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries to Be Commemorated in Sri Lanka
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries to Be Commemorated in Sri Lanka 
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Sri Lankan preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and Feb. 16 was held in Colombo on Jan. 29.
 The ceremony elected Sri Lankan Minister of Justice and Law Reforms Amarasiri Dodangoda supporter for the preparatory committee and Chairman Reggie Ranatunge and Secretary General W. A. Dumindwardane of the Sri Lankaï¿½|People's Korea Friendship Association chairman and secretary general of the preparatory committee.
 The preparatory committee set a commemoration period from Feb. 1 to Apr. 20 and decided to organize colorful functions including seminar, lecture and photo exhibition in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Foreign Countries 
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Meetings, seminars, film shows and photo exhibitions were held in Pakistan, Democratic Congo, Uganda, Libya, Romania, Italy and Egypt in the period from Jan. 21 to Feb. 3 on the occasion of the February holiday.
 Taji Haider, secretary for information of the Pakistan People's Party, said in a speech at a meeting that leader Kim Jong Il is the most outstanding great man in the present times, adding that all miracles and successes in the DPRK would be unthinkable without his guidance.    
 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, noted in his speech at a seminar that the Songun politics of the DPRK has tremendous validity and vitality as it is based on the Juche idea fathered by President Kim Il Sung and developed and enriched by Kim Jong Il.    
 S.N. Serwanga, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People, and Otete Gaston Mboyo, chairman of the National Committee of the Genuine Lumumbist Patriotic Party of Democratic Congo, and other speakers referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il has developed and enriched the Juche idea founded by the President and defended socialism with his original Songun politics and opened a broad avenue for building a great prosperous powerful nation.
 Screened at the film shows were "The Great Leader Comrade  Kim Jong Il Gives On-the-Spot Guidance to the Work in Various Fields", "Old Home in All Its Glory in  Mt. Paektu " and "February 16, the Greatest National Holiday" and other Korean films.
 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings held in Pakistan and Libya.

articles.title: Fact about Former S. Korean Dictator's Behavior for Arms Buildup Disclosed
articles.content:
Fact about Former S. Korean Dictator's Behavior for Arms Buildup Disclosed 
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that late in the 1960s the then south Korean authorities requested the United States to bolster its combat forces under the pretext of "provocations" from the DPRK, according to the south Korean KBS.
 This fact was disclosed by a letter of military fascist dictator Park Chung Hee sent by the south Korean "Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade" to the U.S. president in 1969 and such information as "review of U.S. military assistance to south Korea in 1970".
 At that time Park in his letter to U.S. President Nixon raised a hue and cry over "possible provocation by the north" concerning the Pueblo incident, etc. and stressed the urgent need to take a measure for reinforcing the U.S. air force in south Korea for a prompt retaliation against it.    
 The south Korean authorities, at the same time, asked the U.S. Congress to approve of the "special aid" amounting to 50 million U.S. dollars to south Korea in 197

articles.title: Ten-Day Film Show Opens
Egyptian Military Attache Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Egyptian Military Attache Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Ahmed Medhat, military attache of the Egyptian embassy here, hosted a reception Thursday evening on the occasion of the birthday of leader 
Kim Jong Il.    
 Present on invitation were generals and officers of the Korean People's Army.
 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: 11th Sports Contest of Officials of National Institutions Closed
Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Mohammad Shahta Jarab hosted a reception at the embassy on Thursday evening on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Addressing the reception, the ambassador stressed that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided by President Yasser Arafat and President Kim Il Sung are growing stronger under the concern of Chairman Mahmoud Abbas and Kim Jong Il.    
 Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, said in a speech that the DPRK would make consistent efforts to boost the friendly relations between the two countries and extend full support and solidarity to the Palestinian people in their just cause to retake their legitimate national rights including the foundation of an independent state with Kuds as its capital.
 Present on invitation were Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Tang Su, director of the Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Sports Contest for "Paektusan Cup" Opens
articles.content:
Sports Contest for "Paektusan Cup" Opens 
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A sports contest for "Paektusan Cup" was opened on the occasion of February 16, the greatest auspicious holiday of the nation.
 The contest includes football, basketball, volleyball and ice-hockey matches, figure skating, speed skating and skiing competitions in Pyongyang and Samjiyon.
 An opening ceremony was held at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Thursday.    
 Present at the ceremony were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and sportsmen and sportswomen.
 At the ceremony speakers stressed that in the contest all players should give a good account of themselves by fully displaying the sports techniques they trained in one mind to glorify the honor of Songun Korea with gold medals.    
 At the end of the ceremony a men's basketball match took place.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting for Diplomatic Envoys
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting for Diplomatic Envoys
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs arranged a friendly meeting on Thursday evening for diplomatic envoys of European countries to the DPRK on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys and embassy officials of Sweden, Germany, Poland, Switzerland, the Czech Republic, Bulgaria, Romania and Britain and members of the delegation of the European Commission on a visit to the DPRK.
 On hand were officials of the Foreign Ministry including Vice-Minister Kung Sok Ung.
 Speeches were made at the meeting.    
 The participants deepened friendship, talking to each other about the matter of boosting exchange and cooperation between the DPRK and European countries.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Decision to Join in PSI Drill Assailed
Russian Military Band Gives Premiere Here
Truth about Atomic Artillery Pieces in U.S. Forces in S. Korea Disclosed
S. Koreans Called upon to Struggle against GNP
Establishment of Fair International Order Called for
Art Activities Popularized in DPRK
New Grain Moisture Meter Made in DPRK
articles.content:
New Grain Moisture Meter Made in DPRK
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A new kind of digital grain moisture meter has been developed and manufactured by the Pyongyang Scientific Experimental Apparatus Factory of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 It is applicable to unhulled rice, maize, bean, barley, wheat, rice and other grains.
 The computerized meter can exactly measure the water content of 200 grams of any sample only in 3 seconds. Its measuring error is below 0.5 percent. 
 It, with simple structure, weighs two kilograms. It works even in open-air conditions.
 It is most accurate at the temperature from zero to 35 degrees centigrade. 
 For its accuracy and convenience for use, the grain moisture meter is popular with officials concerned.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Central Military Band
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Central Military Band
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the central military band of the Defence Ministry of Russia on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned on Friday by Valerii Khalilov, chief of the Military Orchestral Service and its chief conductor of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation who is leading the band.

articles.title: Greetings to Iranian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian President
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of the victory in the Islamic revolution of Iran.
 The message noted that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries that entered a new stage in their development after the victory of the Islamic revolution have made good progress in line with the interests and desire of the peoples of the two countries over the last 27 years.    
 It wished the president and people of Iran great success in their work to protect the gains of the Islamic revolution and the democratic national rights of the country and build independent and prosperous Iran.

articles.title: Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of his birthday.
 They were handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Friday by Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah, secretary of the People's Bureau of Libya who is doyen of the corps.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets S. Korean Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets S. Korean Delegation
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of the south Korean Institute for Policy Studies led by Director Rim Chae Jong in an atmosphere overflowing with the compatriotic feelings at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were Ri Jong Hyok, director of the National Reunification Institute, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Greetings to Iranian First Vice-President
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian First Vice-President
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Iranian First Vice-President Parviz Davudi on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of the victory in the Islamic revolution of Iran.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries which have favorably developed over the last 27 years since the victory of the Islamic revolution would continue to grow stronger in various fields, the message sincerely wished the friendly Iranian government and people prosperity and progress. 
 Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Iranian counterpart Manuchehr Mottaki.
